comm: and battle commences with a gentle length delivery outside off which is left well alone by Guptill
gets good carry into the batsman this time from outside off on the same length. Guptill not willing to engage though
well wide outside off as he looks for the outswinger
gets this to swing in from outside off as Guptill gets solidly behind the line
delivers a fuller length now on middle and off as this is defended away with soft hands
slipping down leg as Guptill just about gets this away on the leg side. Ruled leg bye by the umpire
New Zealand on their way with a lofted bludgeon through the covers to this fuller length outside off. Was able to bend his knee slightly to get this to the extra-cover boundary in a hurry
begins with a leg-side delivery which is glanced behind square as Guptill finally gets off the mark
solidly behind the line of this length delivery outside off as this is defended to the off side
back of a length and shaping away as this is punched away through the covers on the up
once again strays on the leg side as all Guptill has to do is clip this through midwicket, with the ball easing up in the deep
simply magnificent from McCullum. Gets a lovely length delivery which is on the fuller side as he is able to scythe this away through the covers to pickup a boundary. Just a wonderful flow of the bat

excellent slower ball right on middle as McCullum sees this just late enough to get his bat down to dig this out as the ball spears away through the slip region. Fantastic response to the shot earlier
nicely behind the line of this length delivery pitched outside off
tries to force this back of a length outside off through the region, but is unable to get past point
gets admirable shape from outside off into the batsman as Guptill just about fends this away
fuller on the pads now as this is clipped away straight to the midwicket fielder, who is able to stop it in, albeit rather clumsily
fantastic improvisation this time from McCullum as he is able to glide this fuller delivery just outside off with an open face as this beats the slipper to the third man boundary
lunges forward nicely to this fullish length outside off to bring the over to a close
full again, and on the pads, as this is eased away on the leg side
length delivery outside off which is dead-batted back to Malinga
operates on a straight line at a decently good length as Guptill has no other option but to defend back towards the bowler
slightly slower ball outside off which is picked early enough as Guptill is able to nurdle this through mid-on to get off the strike. Looked like SL were working to a plan for the tall right-hander
shows his willingness to disturb Malinga's line as he backs away initially before hopping back to dig out this fuller one at the stumps
oversteps this time as he delivers a short of a length which is defended to the leg side. Great opportunity for Guptill to get his eye in here
slips in his trademark yorker on leg which Guptill just about gets away with a swipe behind square as he looked to fish it out
hops as he whips away this length delivery to the leg side
able to get this one past the silly mid-on in place as they execute a tight single
gets the line horribly wrong as this splashes down leg
once again straying down the pads as his inswinger doesn't quite come off, which all Guptill has to do is tickle down to the fine leg boundary for four
shows off his off-side play now with a slap through cover and point which makes it all the way to the boundary rope. This is a cracking pitch!
goes back to his favoured fifth stump line as this one is left well alone
hangs on the back foot before working this off the back foot through to a vacant cow corner as they are nimble enough between the stumps to complete three
solid sound of willow on ball as this one is defended on the front foot to mid-off
overpitched from Malinga as Guptill flicks this away through cow corner to pickup three

looking for the slow yorker but doesn't quite come off as he would have liked as this turns into a slow full toss which McCullum looks to work away down leg but ends up missing the ball entirely as he is struck on the thigh guard. Malinga goes up for a hopeful shout, but no dice from the umpire. End up running a bye during all the commotion
gets nicely behind the line of this length delivery on middle and leg as the long on fielder comes into play
once again gets the slow yorker wrong as he unleashes a low full toss which is hammered straight to mid-off
another slow yorker on middle which this time comes out right from the mould as Brendon brings down the bat in time
begins with a fullish delivery outside off which shapes in with the angle as Brendon shoulders arms. Get generous bounce on the way to the keeper
delivers in the same channel as this time he shortens the length a touch. Defended to the off side once more
rides the bounce to fend this away towards point. Brendon looks a bit fidgety out there, as though he is determined to see NZ to a blazing start
this time opens the face to glide this through the gully region to get off strike
defended away to the leg side
looks to force the issue on the off side but ends up stroking this straight to the short mid-off fielder

Brendon is in that kind of mood. Loose delivery going down leg as McCullum works with the angle to swat this behind square to find the fine leg boundary. This one just raced away off the bat to find the rope

full and once more on the legs as Brendon is getting this World Cup to a rollicking start, flicking this one powerfully away through midwicket as the deep square-leg fielder chases in vain. And to add injury to insult, it is a no-ball as well

Brendon does justice to the term 'free hit' as he picks his spot and launches this full delivery, which turns into a half-volley, over long on for the first six of the match. This Christchurch crowd are in for something special
gets away with this slightly shortish length outside off as Brendon mishits this one away to the off side
can't quite get away this slightly short of a length delivery on the pads
chops it away now, through the gap at second and third slip, to pickup yet another boundary. We are in for a treat folks

searching for the slow yorker, but ends up offering a low full toss which Brendon is able to direct away through midwicket with an angled face to find the gap at the midwicket boundary. This has been some incredible hitting so far
gets this to angle in from outside off as Guptill works this away to the leg side, but straight to silly mid-on
solid, crunching drive down the ground to the boundary rider at long off
defends with a nice straight bat as Mathews puts in a fruitless dive to try and cut this off as it rolls through mid on
blazes away this short of a length outside off as he metes the appropriate treatment to find the point boundary with panache
works with the angle to ease this away to the leg side, but can't pickup the single
simply not enough room to cut this, but he ends up getting away with this one angling in towards off as he chops away to the off side for a quick single to retain the strike
plenty of loop as he lands this on a fuller length on middle, with this one driven solidly to the covers
darts in one on middle and leg which is tucked away behind square
flights this in on middle and off as he defends away to the off side
waits on it before meeting this at the pitch of the ball to drive this down to long off
darts in one on middle and leg which is nurdled down to the same fielder
this one stops on Guptill as he brings the blade down to fend this away to the off side, with the ball in the air temporarily

no room for the cut as Brendon looks for his favoured option, but ends up chopping this close to the body on the off side. This one nips the top of his pad as Mathews goes up for a shout. They deliberate over whether to pursue the review, but decide against it. Looks like he may have got some bat on it after all
another straight-line delivery which is defended by McCullum
able to chip this one over square leg now, rather haphazardly, as they run the single
fended away on the front foot towards the leg side
punched away off the back foot in the general vicinity of mid-off

defends this one with a dead, straight bat as Mathews fields this off his own bowling, getting a finger on the ball as it crashes into the non-striker's stumps. All safe though with no one backing up too much
floated on middle and off as this is lifted over the covers to find the man at deep cover
loud, raucous appeal from Herath as he strikes the pad of Brendon on middle and off, but this might have struck outside
slides in another one which strikes the leg pad, but looked like it was going down leg, despite the shout

offers room outside off which Brendon is able to carve away behind square to pickup a brace. Also gets him the two he needed to bring up the first fifty of the tournament. Has been a superb knock to get his side off to a blistering start
shimmies down the track before slamming Herath with disdain over his head to find the straight boundary. Signature shot from McCullum. Has been batting on a different plane so far
this time waits on it before uncorking a full-blooded drive towards deep extra-cover
something different now from Brendon as he shows his vast range with a paddle to this length delivery outside off as he gets this away through fine leg. Definitely premeditated
Guptill feels a bit left out of the action as he plants his foot to lift Mathews high over long on, but doesn't get the connection he sought as this just about has enough legs to get to the boundary
slower delivery outside off which is stroked away through the backward point region
nice, straight bat as he defends this one softly to the off side
length and given the treatment as Brendon just stands and delivers, hammering this right back over Mathews to find the long off boundary. Fast hands made this shot possible
ends a good over for the hosts with a slap straight to point
ends up defending this one back to the bowler off the back foot
slipping down the leg side now as Guptill is unable to get any bat on it. Nigel Llong soon confirms the decision
floats one in outside off as Guptill looks to be getting more fluent with a corker of a drive on the up through the covers as this one races to the rope
this time waits on it before pushing this down to the man at long off
misreads the line as he gets this to turn away from the bat, with the ball streaking away off the outside edge
slides in a quicker one which is defended ably to the leg side
good use of the feet to create room to nurdle this through mid-on to end the over
starts off with a gentle delivery on middle and leg which is defended to the off side
gives himself room as he backs away to punch this through the covers on the back foot. Runs the first couple hard to return for a third before the throw from the deep
able to ease this one on the front foot to long on
worked away on square leg as they run the single
works with the leg-side slant of this low full toss as he fails to get this past the short backward square fielder
gets deep in the crease to nurdle this off the back foot through midwicket
reaches out to meet this one sliding in on middle and leg
content to stay in his crease as he eases this one away to the leg side
floated on middle as Guptill sweeps this away powerfully to deep square-leg
meets the pitch of the ball to defend this to the off side

invites Brendon to slam him out of the Hagley as he lobs up one on middle and off. Brendon takes the bait, going down the track slightly before lifting him high over long off. Jeevan Mendis, stationed at the position in the deep, is able to gather himself and take this with his back foot just mere inches from the rope. The pro-NZ crowd initially celebrated the likelihood of this going over, before realising what had transpired. Brendon walks off to a good ovation as he has provided this World Cup with a glorious start
driven straight to the fielder at mid-off as all of a sudden the place has quietened down to a murmur

dropped and Lakmal would have got a dream start to his World Cup career as he gets Kane to edge at this fuller length outside off, with a low chance offered to Sangakkara who does get the glove out behind it, but is unable to grasp the ball as it bobbles out before he had any control. Big let-off for NZ
tries out another full delivery outside off, except this time Kane is more vigilant with the extra life he gained
solidly driven on the up, but straight to the cover fielder
rides the bounce of this length delivery outside off as the ball is worked away to the off side
on top of this back of a length as the ball is stroked away to the off side
fuller length now, on the same line, as Williamson gets off the mark with a glide down to third man
gives this one plenty of rip as the ball almost stops on Guptill as he pushes this to the covers
gets a good stride in before defending away to the off side
slipping down leg as Guptill fails to get this past short backward square
reaches out to defend this one with an angled face
full again, outside off, as this is driven just in front of point for one
stops on the batsman as this one is defended back to Herath
short of a length and slapped away with both feet off the ground as he finds the boundary rider at sweeper cover
caressed away on the up through point, but finds the fielder in question
able to squirt this one through the backward point region to complete a brace
defended on the front foot towards the off side
looks to cut this fuller one outside off behind square, but ends up getting a fine inside-edge which beats a sprawling Sangakkara towards the deep fine leg boundary
short this time as Guptill executes the pull shot with aplomb to find deep square-leg
darts in a fuller one on the pads which is clipped away to the mid-on fielder
driven solidly on the up as he locates the man at cover
drops the length outside off as Kane is able to cut this away through the off side
gets this one to straighten in on middle and off as Guptill is late as he is struck on the pad. They are given the required time to decide on whether to go with the review, but decide against it
onto the front foot as this is defended straight to the point fielder
works this leg-side delivery away towards midwicket
looked to direct this length delivery through the covers but ends up mishitting more towards the leg side
Kane has a waft at this slightly short length outside off as the ball drifts away with the shape
tries to punch this away off the back foot, but finds the cover fielder on the ring
continues to operate on a similar channel as Kane is unable to get this away. Looks like he wants to induce the outside edge here
too wide, and full, as Kane is able to run this down to third man to get off the strike
hangs on the back foot as he defends this at the top of the bounce
able to work this one off the pads to get a single
another leg-side delivery which is helped behind square by the batsman
tossed up and driven by Guptill down towards mid-off
this time eases Mendis to the man in question to get off the strike
darted in on middle and off as this meets the same result as the ball before
delivers this last one on off to end a good, tidy over from the Sri Lankan spinner
short and Guptill looks more and more threatening as he unleashes a powerful pull to find the midwicket boundary. Danger signs for SL as he looks to up the ante

but it is Lakmal who has the last laugh as Guptill, just one run shy of a fifty, ends up offering an outside edge to Sangakkara, who is able to launch to his right and catch the ball with both hands before completing the dive safely. Another big blow as Guptill looked to get to a higher gear. Timely wicket for SL
fuller length outside off which is driven back towards the mid-off fielder
good length delivery outside off which is left well alone by the batsman
and he gets off the mark with an outside edge behind square as he played this off the back foot
follows the line perilously close as this short of a length almost removes another New Zealand batsman
charges down the track to needle this through long-off
gets nicely behind this quicker one darted in on middle and off
looks to create room on the off side to glide Herath through gully, but finds the slipper
goes for the release shot over cow corner, and gets it as he is able to get enough bat on this lofted sweep to find the boundary in the vacant region
defended with soft hands as the ball trickles behind square on the off side
defends with a slightly, angled blade to bring the over to a close
looks to steer Lakmal through the covers but ends up mistiming the shot back to the bowler
executes the perfect tip-and-run as he plays with soft hands to the leg side, and close to the body, to get the single away
defended on the front foot as the ball rolls to the off side

delivers a fuller one just outside off which Kane gets an inside-edge on as this just misses the stumps to creep behind square on the leg side. Taylor calls for the run straight away, and it turns out to be a good option. These two have quite the mixed history between the sticks
short of a length and rides the bounce competently enough to get away a single on the leg side
fullish length outside off which is struck back at the bowler as we approach the mid-way point of the innings
advances down the track before nurdling this one away through square-leg
looks to shimmy down the track before aborting to readjust and defend this away to the leg side with soft hands
good use of the feet as he chips this one over extra-cover, but not enough for this to carry to the fielder in that region, who is able to field the ball on the bounce
punched away off the back foot, but straight back at the bowler
floated on middle and off as this is eased down to the fielder at long off
drifts this one in on middle and leg as Ross is able to fend this away safely
length on middle and off which is struck back at the bowler, who offers up a hand to cut it off
shuffles across to his off stump in an attempt to get away a shot through the leg side, but ends up edging this one away to the opposite area
turned away off the pads as they complete a straightforward single to bring up the 150
on the front foot again as this one is defended close to the body
shows off the maker's name as he presents a dead, straight bat to the bowler
slips in a fullish length outside off which is carved away through the covers by Kane
begins his spell with a slightly short delivery outside off which is punched back to him
fuller one outside off which Ross is unable to glide away as he ends up hitting this towards point
ends up running this length delivery outside his off stump with a thickish edge down to third man
short and Kane dashes down the pitch to try and careen this over cow corner, but ends up making a sweet connection with thin air
short of a length outside off which is fended away to the off side
length outside off which he tries to chop through the gully region, but doesn't get it away quite where he wanted it
finds the channel outside off with this length delivery as Kane just runs this one down to third man
Ross once again trying to work this through the off side, with this one quite not going as far as he wanted. Kane was alert to the single though, and is able to get to the danger end despite the risk
steers this fuller one by opening the face to get it down to third man
delivers a fuller length now, which angles in, as this is defended on the front foot
shortish length outside off which offers Ross the chance to free his arms as he dabs this down to the third man fielder

dropped length outside off which is slapped hard by Kane, but he finds the short cover fielder, who puts out his right hand to try and catch this, but is unable to get anything on it. Would have been a brilliant take, and probably a tad harsh to call it a dropped chance, more of a half-chance really
Kane able to pickup a single through extra-cover to get Ross on strike
is quite late on this pull shot as the ball ends up back in the bowler's hands
once again content to steer this one down to third man
short and wide and given the appropriate treatment as Kane rocks back to pull this one through cow corner for four. Just sat up for Williamson, who seemed to have all day to play it
punches this one off the back foot through the covers
slightly wide on a fullish length as Kane is able to direct this one away to the deep extra-cover fielder
steered away off the back foot towards the cover fielder
waits on the back foot before defending this to the bowler
looks to advance down the track before repositioning to hit this back towards the bowler
shuffles back to whip this behind square for one

whisked away off the pads in the same region as there is a flutter of interest from the close-in fielders when they hear the eventual "No!" call from one of the batsmen, but they end up running the single safely in the end
unable to pickup a single on the leg side as the over comes to a close
punched away off the back foot, but straight at the cover fielder
able to shovel Kula over cow corner as enters the 40s. Sri Lanka know the danger of Williamson too well

Kane showing his class as he expertly uses his feet to lift Kula high over long off for a stunning six. This was just so classical in the execution as someone in the stand is able to make a one-handed catch. Outstanding cricket all around!
this turned away to the leg side as Williamson returns for a brace
able to whip away Kula through midwicket as he brings up his half-century. Has been another superb knock from Williamson. This is his 13th half-century in his last 17 ODIs
Ross content to just drive this one straight at the short cover fielder to end a superb over for New Zealand
looks for the sweep but is slightly late on it
wants to get down the track but ends up hitting this at the bowler
turned away just in front of square as they hustle hard to complete the second in time after the initial misfield
whipped away off the pads as they look again for two, but this time Mahela is like, uh, I don't think so?
eases this one away now to the fielder at long on as New Zealand continue to cruise
heading down the leg side as Kane fails to get any bat on it after the initial attempt. Ends up being called wide by the umpire
Kane is just on another level as he is able to whip Dilshan away through cow corner with a chip that races to the boundary
gives this one plenty of air as Ross covers for the turn away
another close mix-up here as Ross is late on Kane's call after he works this one behind square. Kane hares for the striker's end before Ross sets off, and is able to make his end despite the throw

and this is what Cricket World Cups are all about. Another promising batsman has to depart the Hagley as Lakmal has reignited this SL team with a fantastic running catch at cow corner after Williamson had lifted the bowler over that region. Puts in a dive to his right to complete the whole emsemble. Looked like one of the only ways to remove Kane, who has been in sparkling form of late

what a beauty to get this over away after the break as he tosses one up on middle which turns away from Ross, who is late on it as Sangakkara moves experly behind to complete the take and remove the bails just before Ross is able to get his foot back on the line, so this looks like it is out. Ruled not out by the umpire initially, so the umpire wants to have a closer look. Replays look as though he might be just out before both the bails were dislodged, as it looks like presently only one of the bails were removed before Taylor got his foot back across the line. This really is touch and go. The verdict has come in and he is out
Anderson is able to suffer the all-important ball as this is defended away softly to the off side
punched away off the back foot this time, but locates the cover fielder soon after to dissuade the thought of a single
Elliott able to get off the mark with a drive through extra-cover
floats this one in on middle and off as Anderson brings down the bat
once again fended away by the burly all-rounder
this time succeeds in getting away a punch through extra-cover

another mix-up which ends up working out for NZ as Elliott looks for the single behind square, with Anderson making the call, but although Elliott struggled initially, he is able to make it back to his end in the nick of time
directs this one back past the bowler, who puts in a dive to try and reach out to it in his follow through
looks to drive this one past the bowler through mid-off, but ends up hitting it more on long on
punched away this time towards the covers
gets nice and low to defend this one on the front foot
tries to work it past the bowler, but fails to do so
driven firmly towards extra-cover as they complete a single
sweeps this one on the full, but straight to short backward square
able to pickup a single down the leg side after the fumble by the silly mid-on fielder
steers Dilshan through long off to rotate the strike
ends up defending this one straight to the close-in fielder on the leg side
gets away a fortuitous boundary down the leg side after getting a bottom-edge to the sweep, with this one trickling away through deep fine leg
this time gets it away a touch squarer on the leg side for one

goes down the track and clubs this right over long on, with the fielder in the deep at cow corner, Chandimal, who is on as a sub, running hard to his right and then putting in a leap with his right hand out to try and replicate the effort in the crowd before, but this one goes all the way past him and over the rope to bring up six, much to the delight of the Hagley
begins with a length delivery outside off which is allowed to sail through to the keeper
able to turn this length delivery on the pads to the leg side for one
gets this one well wide of off stump as the umpire swivels to signal the scorer
able to get away a single down to long off to bring Elliott on strike
Elliott doesn't move a muscle as Malinga fires in another wide outside off stump. Hasn't quite got his radar on
better now from the slinger as this one lands on a length just outside off which is defended away by the batsman
and yet another wide, this time down the leg side. The Hagley crowd starting to get into it now
this time picks up a run with a shot directed at short cover
tries for the yorker but ends up delivering a low full toss which is crashed away through the mid-off region
looks to carve this fullish length outside off through the covers, but ends up picking the fielder in the ring
able to glide this short of a length down to third man for one
has a flash at this fuller one with the shot not on offer, but ends up getting an inside-edge which streaks past the stumps to reach the fine leg boundary
tries once more to laser one through the covers, but is late on the ball
once again looking to scythe through the covers, but ends up getting a bottom-edge which slides the ball over to the leg side. Seems to be dragging the stroke somewhat
full, outside off, which is driven firmly to mid-off
hangs on the back foot before fending away to the off side
width outside off which is slashed hard at by Elliott
able to needle this through the gap at point as he reached out to this attempted wide yorker. Ends up in the hands of sweeper cover
length outside off which Elliott steers expertly to deep extra-cover
Anderson strikes this fullish length right at the man at mid-on, whose hands are probably stinging at the rate of knots it was sent to him
squeezes a single through point to this wide, fuller delivery from Malinga to retain the strike
slower ball which dips towards outside off as Anderson is able to stroke this away square off the wicket on the off side
excellent line and carry as he gets this devilishly close to Elliott's outside edge as he looked to play inside
Elliott goes down the pitch now as he slams through the line, but doesn't quite middle it enough to beat Jeevan Mendis at long on
looks to glide this one down through the slip region to get the big left-hander back on strike

full and room outside off as he searches for the wide yorker. Anderson is able to get down on one-knee to scythe this away powerfully through extra-cover to bring up a welcome boundary for NZ . First one he has timed away off the square
stand and deliver from Anderson as he finds Mendis at long off with a swat on one knee
full delivery just outside off which is driven straight to long off
low and slow full toss which almost deceives Elliott as he is late on the flick, but gets a single to short fine leg
low and slow full toss which almost deceives Elliott as he is late on the flick, but gets a single to short fine leg
has a play-and-a-miss to this length delivery outside off
tries to force this one on the off side, but can't get it away
searching for the blockhole as this one is directed down to mid-off to end the over

finds the boundary they were looking for with a slap to this shortish length outside off as he backs away to create the desired room. This one just gets away to the rope after slowing up in the outfield
this time plays it straighter to pinpoint the fielder at long on
looking for the wide yorker but gets it a bit too wide for his liking
drags the shot again as he looks to carve this full delivery which is almost yorker-length through the covers
able to steal a single with a simple tip-and-run on the off side, with Elliott wise to the run
in the zone but all Elliott can do is squeeze this out to the boundary rider at deep cover. That also pushes the NZ score past 250
able to dig out this fuller one just outside off for a single
follows the batsman with this yorker targeting the toes as Elliott looked to back away and flick down the leg side
low full toss which should have been dispatched with properly, but ends up being slapped straight to the man at deep cover
Anderson able to locate the vacant extra-cover region with a chip over the inner ring which beats long off to the boundary
shuffles over to his off stump in an attempt to throw Lakmal off his lines as he looks for the wide yorker once more, with Anderson eventually squeezing out a bottom-edge through third man

and Lakmal picks up another as he gets Elliott to hole out to deep midwicket with a pull that hits the fielder straight at the chest. The umpire is having a check for no-ball in case this went over the waist, but replays show this was marginally on the line of being called no-ball or not, but they decide to be pragmatic as Elliott is given his marching orders
full toss which shapes outside off as Anderson bludgeons this away to the deep extra-cover boundary, with long off putting in a successful dive to cut this off
content to defend this first one on the front foot as he looks to get a sighter at the slinger
whipped away off the pads to get Ronchi to a fine start as his tally moves to four runs
shortish length which Ronchi rides on top off quite competently

length outside off, with not much room outside off, but somehow Ronchi is able to open the face to glide this uppishly through gully to get a boundary. Quite amazing how he managed a boundary out of that delivery
this time elects to rock onto the back foot as he goes for the good-old midwicket swivel-pull
straight and all Anderson has to do is merely push at it to get it down to long off

almost takes off Lakmal's head with a bludgeon through the line as Lakmal has to quickly evade from the path of this hit from Anderson through long on. Really would have decapitated him had he stayed in place, while Nigel Llong also does his best Neo impression as he backed out of its way

Anderson turning it on at the Hagley as he gropes out to this full, wide yorker before getting enough under it by angling the bat to lift this just over the backward point fielder to get four before third man could sweep upon it

dropped Mendis drops an absolute sitter at cover after Anderson makes a hash of this low full toss going across him, with this one striking off centre on the bat to get a top-edge which goes high up, before falling straight through the hands of Mendis who is unable to take it safely. Lots of sad looks and disappointment across the field
Lakmal just wants to go home. Ends up offering a leg-side delivery which Ronchi helps away with a swivel-paddle to find the fine leg boundary. This has been a superb over so far for NZ
searching for the yorker as he gets this slightly off line outside off, with Ronchi able to run this down towards third man
another low full toss which is sent screaming into the non-striker's stumps as the pair are unable to get away a single after the ball made contact with timber
full delivery just outside off which Anderson gets an inside-edge on as he almost drags this onto the stumps. Doesn't stop the pair from completing a quick single though
trademark Malinga there as he delivers right on the money as Ronchi just digs this out from middle before getting away a quick single
smashes this fuller one past the bowler to locate long off

Malinga back to his finest now as he sends off stump cartwheeling back after Ronchi's failed dig to get this away on the off side, but hang on to your hats folks, it looks like he may have overstepped here. The Hagley Crowd suddenly spring into life as the replay is shown on the big screen. Looks like he may have just got a portion of the boot behind the line when he landed the foot, but it is so close. And much to SL's dismay, Ronchi is given another life as they deem the ball a no-ball
gets in another yorker which this time Ronchi is able to get under as he steals a single to get Anderson on the hot seat
fuller one outside off which doesn't quite land in line of the stumps as Anderson is able to club this away to long on
another almost yorker-length delivery which is worked away to the off side to end the over
full and spearing into middle and off as this is struck straight to mid off
Anderson clubs away another meaty blow, this time through long off, as he brings up his maiden World Cup fifty in fine style. NZ will be hoping he can get in a few more
and boy can he hit them. Full, almost a low full toss, and all Anderson has to do is get under it to slam this over long on this time for six. Danger signs emanating from the middle for SL
doesn't really bowl to the set plan as he slips in a slightly shortish length which is swatted away through midwicket
right on the money as this one is dug out in the general direction of mid-on
able to get this fuller one on the pads away through to cow corner as the pair run the first one hard in order to complete two
whisked away off the pads just in front of square
just about manages to squeeze away this Malinga special through the cover region
finds the blockhole again as Ronchi is just about able to dig it out to the leg side before getting down to the other end

shows he can play 360-degree cricket too as he shuffles over low to his off side to angle this fuller delivery outside off high over fine leg with a flick of the wrists to get this to the boundary with a couple of bounces. Excellent shot with the 7-2 off side field
drags his bottom hand as he looks to power one away through the covers, but some rather lackadaisical fielding at cow corner affords him the opportunity to return for his second
full and on target as Anderson blitzes this straight to mid-on to retain the strike as we enter the final over of the innings
slow bouncer on the leg stump which Anderson sees early enough as he is able to swivel and hook this over fine leg to get a boundary
in the blockhole this time as Anderson is able to dig one out towards midwicket
wide yorker which Ronchi just about reaches as he squirts one away to deep cover
another wide yorker which Ronchi this time gets away through the extra-cover region as he finds the vacant space to pickup four
this time clubbed away towards cow corner as Anderson gets set to face the last delivery
and Anderson has to depart the Hagley without the asterisk to his name as he holes out rather softly to the cover fielder, who takes the chance on the second take
Southee begins with a leg-side delivery which the Thirimanne tries to get away
gets solidly behind the line of this length delivery swinging back into him
short of a length and shaping away as this is fended away to the off side
gets a thick outside edge as he looks to lean into a cover drive, with this one falling safely away from the slip to his left
turned away off the pads behind square as Dilshan gets off the mark with a well-ran two
punched away off the back foot to end a tidy opening over for NZ

Thirimanne punches this length delivery outside off through the point region, with the chasing fielder able to win the race in the end, but it looks as though he may have dragged his foot on the rope when he looked to gather it, so signalled four runs
fuller on the pads as this is clipped away to mid-on
steered away on the back foot behind square on the off side
defended solidly towards the off side as Dilshan steps down the track a touch
gets a fortunate boundary with this inside-edge which streaks past the stumps as he looked to throw the kitchen sink at this short of a length ball going across him
tries again but doesn't quite time it despite been given a wider line to work with
driven firmly on the back foot towards the direction of mid-off
nicely behind the line as this one is fended softly to the leg side
is well early on this pull as he ends up chopping onto the body
fires in a short delivery which Dilshan is well late on as he looks for the hook
looks to thrash hard at this length delivery outside off, but plays down the wrong line as the ball deviates inside upon hitting the pitch
solidly behind the line as this one is nurdled down to mid-on
tries to force the issue on the off side with a punch, but ends up running a quick single when he doesn't quite get it past the ring
delivers one on middle which is defended back to him by the batsman
falls over a touch as he defends this one from the crease
full this time as he shifts the line outside off, with Dilshan getting away a streaky shot through third man
follows this shorter one from Boult as he looks for the ramp, but doesn't quite go to plan for Thirimanne
able to fend away this length delivery angling in on off and middle
tries to get Southee away on the leg side, but mistimes the stroke
looks to crash away this length delivery through the off side as he goes hard again, but doesn't get it away. Has struggled for timing early on in this innings so far

brings the line a touch closer to the batsman as Dilshan is able to drive this one on the up through extra-cover, before McCullum, at mid-off, is able to run at full tilt to his left before putting in a splendid, rolling dive to stop this in its tracks
this time opens the face to run this off-side slanting delivery through to third man
is late on this goodish length delivery which cuts in upon pitching, striking him on the thigh pad
another one which he is late on as this time he inside-edged onto the body to end the over
Thirimanne steers this length delivery shaping away on the up through point to earn a couple
gets nicely on top of the bounce to defend this with an angled blade
full and in the slot as Thirimanne unleashes a drive through long off which has no one bothered to chase it. Extremely important runs for SL early on in this chase
content to glide this shortish length delivery outside off to third man
this time Dilshan searches for the drive on the up through the covers, but finds Brendon at mid-off
goes round the line to Dilshan as the right-hander plays inside of the line of this one shaping away. Really was a pearl of a delivery from Boult
able to glide this length delivery on middle down to third man
length outside off which is careened away by Dilshan through the covers, but once again is stopped within the ring
short and he looks to get on top of this, which he does comfortably enough to pickup a boundary through square-leg. Looked slightly awkward as he got away the stroke, but it gets the desired result
looks for the cut behind square on the off side, but pinpoints the fielder at backward point
angles one in from outside off as Dilshan brings down the blade in the nick of time

length which just jags back into the right-hander as there is a noise as this goes past the inside-edge of Dilshan's bat. They go up for the appeal, but there doesn't seem to be any urgency on the part of the NZ fielders. Replays confirm that it was a good decision as the sound emanated from the ball brushing past the pad
tucks away Boult to the leg side, and that too with soft hands
shifts the line wider of off as Thirimanne is given ample room to free his arms, but cuts this straight to the point fielder, which he probably didn't aspire to do
once again on top of the bounce as this one is fended away deftly to the leg side
yorker on middle and leg which Thirimanne sees early enough as he backs away and then gets low to drive this through the covers, which he does with classical elegance
short now and this time Thirimanne is equal to it, rocking onto the back foot to hook this over to the backward square boundary. Looks like he is willing to take the lead in the partnership
tries to steer one past the keeper as this one slants in from outside off, but Ronchi is equal to the task
length ball which angles in a smidgen as this is defended off the back foot
not quite got a hold of this one as he ends up dragging this to mid-off, with the intention of going through the covers
pushed firmly by Dilshan on the up, but can't get it past a leaping short mid-off
goes round the wicket to Thirimamne now as the left-hander has a go at this length delivery wide of off
and that move has cost them four runs as Thirimanne expertly weaves this past short third man to pinpoint the gap at the boundary
gets far too early into his stroke as he gets a bottom-edge to this attempted pull which is collected by Ronchi
unleashes a 138 kph firebolt which squares up Dilshan as he is late on this attempted glance to the leg side, with the ball catching the outside edge to fly towards third man
Thirimanne content to get behind the line as this one slants away upon pitching on middle and leg
rapid stuff from Milne, on middle, as this one is fended away by the batsman
fuller and on the pads as this is clipped away through midwicket for one
not quite that short but Dilshan goes for the pull anyways as he gets this away through midwicket, running the first one hard in order to come back in time for the second
squirts this length delivery outside his off stump to the man at point
begins with one darted in on leg which is flicked away by Thirimanne to the leg side
plays the correct line to this one turning in a touch on off
fuller one on the pads which is neatly tucked away behind square
far too wide outside off as Dilshan frees his arms to scythe this away through cover. Brings up the SL 50 as well
content to steer Vettori square off the wicket on the off side as they continue to rotate strike
charges down before driving on the up past Vettori to his left to end his first over
spearing in on middle and leg as he looks for the yorker, with this one successfully dug out to the leg side

uppish strike through the covers from Thirimanne as this one flies through the space to find the extra-cover boundary after a couple of bounces. Resembled Sangakkara there as he finished with a flourish of the bat
driven firmly on the up, but straight to the mid-off fielder
shows Dilshan his version of the ramp as he successfully gets under this shorter one to find the boundary at third man
fires in a 142 kph thunderbolt which is edged away to the off side by Thirimanne
just short enough for Dilshan to pull as he gets this away towards midwicket

tries to tickle this leg-side slanting delivery fine past short backward square, with the fielder able to pounce on this quickly before firing a throw at the wrong end as the batsman at the striker's end looked just short of his ground
defended by Dilshan to the off side
driven firmly through the covers by the batsman
makes a little room outside his off stump to glide this away to third man
gets down the track before padding this one which turns into him to the leg side

and Dilshan departs the Hagley in the softest of ways as he offers a straightforward lob to this one pushed through by Vettori on middle and leg, with the spinner hardly in any trouble as he completed the catch. Dilshan walks away rather ignominiously from the middle as Sri Lanka lose their first wicket of the innings
Thirimanne able to glance this length delivery off the pads to bring Sangakkara on strike, much to the delight of the Sri Lankan fans in the crowd
immediately delivers a wide down the leg side to the experienced left-hander
withdraws the blade to this length delivery going across him

pushed through on the front foot by Sangakarra just in front of point, with Sangakkara's call to get to the other end late. He takes a couple of steps, sees the imminent danger, and scurries desperately to his end. A direct hit would have ended his innings prematurely
more than happy to let this one going across him through to Ronchi
defended away to the off side
excellent bouncer to finish it off as Sangakkara weaves out of any trouble
steers this one past a diving silly mid-on to find the long on fielder
can't get it past Vettori who puts in a lovely dive in his follow through
this time steered away off the pads to the leg side as Sangakkara finally gets his 2015 World Cup tally going
ends up playing this one back to the bowler as Vettori continues to operate a tight line
shifts the line of attack outside off as Thirimanne is able to dab this away square on the off side
goes down the track before placing this through midwicket for a brace
goes round the wicket to Thirimanne as the left-hander goes for the old fashioned tip-and-run outside his off stump
short from the bowler as Sangakkara plays at it with deft hands to get Thirimanne back on strike
looks composed as he elects to run this short of a length delivery outside off to third man
in the slot and all Sangakkara has to do is unfurl his trademark, bended-knee cover drive as this one whistles to the ropes. Glorious shot from the elder statesman

and he gets past 1000 World Cup runs to become the third Sri Lankan to the mark with a wristly tickle to this leg-side slanting delivery. Another significant milestone for the left-hander. He has also passed Ricky Ponting on the ODI run-scorer's list to go to second all time after Sachin Ramesh Tendulkar
gets away a single through midwicket to end a historic over for Sangakkara and ODI cricket
whips away this fuller delivery past the bowler to get it down to long on

dropped it is all happening here at the Hagley! Thirimanne offers a straightforward lob to McCullum which creeps up high as he just mistimes the jump at silly mid-on to try and catch this one hand. Ends up bobbling over as he picks up the ball and fires in a throw at the non-striker's, which he connects. Would have been a horrid way to go for Thirimanne, though
driven along the ground to long on by the left-hander
punched away off the back square off the wicket as he brings up his fifty after that let-off just earlier. Has really taken the lead in this innings for SL so far
able to clip this away on the leg side, but can't find the space he sought
defended away close to the body on the leg side
slipping down leg as Sangakkara punishes him for straying on the pads, getting away a flick behind square which powers away to the boundary
defended on the front foot towards the fielder at mid-off
once again focuses on that middle and off line as Sangakkara brings down the hammer
Sangakkara able to ease away Boult square off the wicket as he sets off for a quick single, making his ground before the throw knocked down the stumps
directed away towards the covers by Thirimanne
just about squeezes away this back of a length slanting in from outside off
Elliott continues to operate round the wicket as he lets go of a slower ball which is crashed away square off the wicket on the off side
looks to shuffle over before running this one straight into the lap of slip
driven authoritatively through the line, but can't get it past the long off fielder
nurdled away off the back foot through the leg side by Sangakkara
lunges forward before working this away towards point
picks the slower ball outside his off stump before launching this over long off to find the boundary after a couple of bounces. They needed the boundary, and he backed himself to get it
takes a leaf from Thirimanne's book as he advances down the track to chip Boult over a deepish mid-off, who despite the leap to his left and back, is unable to get any paws on it
straighter now from Boult as this is whisked away on the leg side for one
content to glide this one outside his off stump to third man
fuller and on the pads as this is whipped away to midwicket
full and spearing in on middle as Thirimanne just about does enough to dig this away to point
pushes at this length delivery which angles away as Boult puts in a scrambled dive to take most of the pace off it
offers up a loopy delivery outside off as he comes round the wicket to the left-hander, with this one blitzed away through the covers
offers up a low full toss which is tucked away to midwicket. Missed out on a juicy full toss here
short and wide as Thirimanne cuts at this hard to find deep extra-cover
looks to get to the pitch of the ball as he leaves the safety of his crease to caress this through the covers. The shot also brings up their fifty-run partnership
this time nurdled away to the off side by Thirimanne
able to get it away to deep midwicket to finish off the over
pushed at the top of the bounce past a diving Boult as this one lands up at long off
length outside off which is steered away behind square on the off side
simply not enough room to cut this short of a length delivery outside off, but manages to get it away all the same
blazes away a drive on the up through point, but the fielder is equal to the task
runs this one away down to third man as they run the first one hard in order to come back for the second as Thirimanne puts in the dive to make his ground

and Boult knocks over Thirimanne to get the Hagley crowd off its seats as off stump is sent rocketing back. Lovely outswinging yorker which Thirimanne played down the wrong line. Still, it was a wonderful knock to get his side off to a smooth start in this run-chase
content to tuck away Vettori down the leg side
darts one in on middle and leg as Sangakkara finds the single he was looking for
Mahela fronts up to his first delivery with a well-executed front foot defence
this time looks to guide it past the silly mid-off, which he is unable to do so
defended from the crease by Mahela

and NZ's most experienced hand comes up with the goods as he gets Mahela to offer an outside edge to Ronchi behind, who snaps up the take gleefully. Nothing special about the delivery really, but the pressure before did the trick. Huge wicket for NZ as Mahela departs the oval without troubling the scorers
driven firmly to the silly mid-off fielder
solidly behind the line as Sangakkara looks to regroup with his new partner

picks up a boundary through long on with a mere push to this length delivery coming in at him. Looked so routine that everyone, including myself, was surprised to see it race away to the boundary rope
pitched up just outside off as this one is hit towards point, with the fielder taking the ball and firing in a shy at the non-striker's

Boult has got his man. He has enjoyed the wood over Sangakkara in the Tests, now he may have just got his man here. Sangakkara is well late on this inswinging, full delivery coming in from outside off. Was looking to shimmy down the track before seeing the fuller length, before deciding to readjust the stroke to get it away down leg. He is struck right in line of the stumps as he falls over a touch. He takes a couple of steps down to look behind him before he sees the umpire raise the finger after Boult's initial appeal. Wants a review right away, but this looked dead on, with replays confirming that this was indeed going on to hit the stumps. Sangakkara has to go, and with that possibly the hopes of many Sri Lankans, both at the ground and back home
goes round the wicket to Mathews as the captain gets his tally away with a fortuitous boundary courtesy of a low outside edge which escapes away through third man to the rope
continues to operate on a nice, tight line as Dimuth is given no room for quarter
gets deep in the crease as he defends on the back foot
shorter now, on the leg stump, as this is whipped away behind square
slows this one in the air as Mathews is given nothing to work with as he tries to get this away on the leg side
another slow delivery which Mathews can't punish
wider outside off now as Mathews is given precious room to cut this away through backward square
onto the front foot as this is fended away with soft hands
short from Boult as this one is worked away off the back foot towards the vicinity of midwicket
opens the face to try and run this past third man, but ends up hitting it straighter to him
spears in a fuller one angling in on middle as this is clipped away to the leg side
shortish length outside off which is struck away towards the off side
works with the slanting angle to glance this away to midwicket
nicely on top of this as he tucks it away off the pads before setting off for a quick single, which the pair complete in quick time
pushes at this one pitched outside off as he locates the fielder at mid-off
turned away off the pads just behind square as they continue to rotate strike
looks to just whip this one away on the leg side for one
this time slips down the leg side, a rarity for someone of Vettori's pedigree
better now as he slides one in on middle and off
tries to guide this through the covers before hitting this one straight back at Vettori, who fields the ball
tries to force the issue on the off side with a back-foot punch, but no dice
picks up a single with an easy-as-you-like dab on the leg side
slants in an inswinging delivery from outside off with the round-the-wicket angle as Mathews is up to the mark
this time steers away on the back foot to locate the fielder at third man
full and swinging in at the base of the pads as Dimuth plays all around it. Boult has a cheeky smile as he walks back to his mark
punched away off the back foot towards midwicket
tucked away off the back foot towards the fielder at long on
gets this devilishly close to the outside edge of Mathew's bat as he brought down the blade to defend
this time plays the right line as the ball is defended softly back to Vettori
pushed at firmly, but Vettori sees it early to put in the dive to his right
squares up Mathews with a beautiful flighted delivery on middle and off
drifted outside off as Mathews has a go, hitting this uppishly towards the gully fielder, who is able to complete the take
begins with a length delivery on middle and off which is safely negotiated by the batsman
drops the line on middle and leg as this is pulled away just behind square on the leg side

length outside off which is slapped away through the covers, with Mathews wanting a single from the get-go, which he ends up getting after Mathews puts in the dive at the non-striker's after casually jogging the first few steps
solid thud of the bat as the ball is met with outside off
content to tuck away a brace through midwicket
short of a length and defended from the crease as Milne's over comes to a close
loopy delivery on off, dead-batted down the pitch
struck back at the bowler, who puts in another useful dive to snap it up
fractionally short from Vettori and punished by Mathews as he pulls this fiercely through cow corner to find the boundary in no time
this time punched away through the covers by the right-hander
once again tries to get it past the cover fielder, this time succeeding enough to find the man at deep extra-cover
gropes out to this one pitched just outside off to paddle it round the corner to fine leg
length on the pads which is whisked away behind square for an easy single
length again outside off which is dead-batted close to the body as they are able to pinch the quick single

decides to operate round the wicket now to Dimuth, and the plan comes off as he gets Dimuth to play all around this length delivery shaping in with the angle, striking the top of off stump. Milne picks up his first as Dimuth is sent packing from the Hagley
what a jaffa! Milne's trajectory from round the wicket is simply impeccable as Jeevan plays inside the line of it. The pace, the angle, the shape. Fast bowling at its finest
this time shifts the line a touch closer, but oversteps as he searches for that extra yard of pace

tries him out with a shorter one which Jeevan just about gets away, albeit not convincingly as this one flies high and handsome over midwicket, with the fielder stationed near there, Anderson, unable to get any hands on it as the wind seemed to blow this past him to the boundary rope

definite sound as this one went past the batsman's blade, with the NZ keeper and bowler absolutely sure they have got their man. The umpire remains nonplussed however, but NZ want the review. Initial camera angles don't show anything conclusive, but Snicko has a different story as there was definite contact with the bat. Another blow to SL's chance as Mendis heads back to the pavilion
gets this to drift away outside off as Mathews plays down the wrong line
wider from Vettori as Mathews eases this away to deep extra-cover
slipping down the leg side now as Nuwan stays well within the confines of his crease
gets this one to straighten just outside off as Nuwan presents the maker's name
once again content to dead-bat this back towards the bowler
another one pitched outside off which is worked away through cover to end the over
fullish length outside off which is driven straight to the cover fielder

length outside off which catches the outside edge as Ronchi gets low to his right to get under the ball. Erasmus gives Nuwan his marching orders, but Nuwan is not convinced this carried all the way through to the keeper. No problem with the front foot there, although the camera angles show this may not have carried all the way. This may have gone to grass though... and the umpires agree as they overrule the original decision. Definitely was some concern if this had carried to Ronchi
length which is pushed at by Nuwan as a misfield at mid-off allows for the run to be taken. Probably the first time all day that NZ have made a blunder in the field
leg-side slanting delivery which is flicked away uppishly to deep backward square
delivers a bouncer on off stump which is deemed too high for the batsman to engage with
withdraws the blade to this length delivery outside off
angling in from outside off as Kula leans into a lovely drive through long on to pickup four valuable runs for Sri Lanka
drifts in one on middle and off which is met with a dead, straight bat
is late on this one floated in on the same channel
expertly guides Vettori through long off
turned away to the leg side as they pickup a quick single
straddles down leg as the umpire signals to the scorer
given no room outside his off stump to work him away
gives this one plenty of air to end a terrific ten-over spell of 2 for 34. Has been a champion bowler for NZ today
139 kph, starts off with a length delivery down the pads which is signalled wide by the umpire
short outside off from Mline as the umpire calls one for the over
137 kph, follows him with a fuller delivery on the pads which is just about dug away by Mathews
133 kph, another short bouncer from Milne outside off which is given the second warning to by third umpire
137 kph, squares up Kula with a peach of a delivery shaping in from outside off as this one runs away off the outside edge to third man
looking for the block hole as he gets this too full, with Mathews striking this one back to Milne on his follow through
fullish length angling in from outside off and worked away towards mid-off
starts round the wicket to Mathews who seems content to guide this away through the off side
short of a length and angling in from outside off as this is punched away towards the covers
length which is slipping down leg as Mathews gets away Anderson with a deft flick
dropped Anderson's doesn't take long to bring about a chance as he gets Kula to feather a chance to Taylor at slip, who goes hard at it before dropping the chance. Kula survives again
this time gets away a single through midwicket

once again looks to get it away through square-leg, but the fielder picks up the ball soon after to fire in a throw at the striker's end, with the batsman just short of his crease as he made his dive back
and straight away Kula has a flash at him, going hard at this length delivery outside off stump
hangs on the back foot as he looks to slap one away past point, but to no avail
jumps in his crease as he whips away this length delivery off the pads

Mathews looks to disturb Southee's lines as he advances down the track to this shorter one which ends up cramping the right-hander as he looks for the pull through midwicket, instead getting a top-edge which flies safely away from any fielders over extra-cover
short again and this time Mathews pounces on it more effectively, dispatching this over the midwicket boundary for four
slanting down leg now as Mathews looks to tickle this past short backward square, but finds the fielder
continues round the wicket as he gets Mathews to drive at this fuller one down to the fielder at long off

advances down the track in an attempt to clear the close-in field on the off side, but all he ends up doing is top-edging a chance to Elliott at deep extra-cover, who comes forward to take the catch. Kula has run out of lives as he departs for 10
defended away by Mathews to the off side
cut away past backward point, who puts in a dive to take most off the pace from it, before the ball continues through to make it to the third man boundary
steers this length delivery towards the cover fielders
returns to over the wicket now as Rangana fends away this length delivery to the off side
short and all Mathews has to do is back away and ramp this high over backward point to find the boundary
looked to clear the Hagley as he backed away to set himself, before shuffling back a touch to defend this to the off side
sends this fuller one from Southee screaming to the fielder at mid-off, who does well to get to the ball in time
delivers a lovely, swinging delivery across the batsman who has a push at the ball as it went past
just a touch short now as Herath is able to pull this fiercely through midwicket to get Mathews on strike
has a half-hearted swipe at this leg-side slanting, slower bouncer from Southee. Called wide by the umpire
targeting the pads now as this is clipped away by Mathews for a single through midwicket to retain the strike
full delivery which is driven towards the off side by the batsman
looks to go for the hook over fine leg before deciding to simply follow the ball with a swivel
too short from Anderson as Nigel Llong signals wide to the scorer
delivers a fuller line now, up around middle and off, as this is driven away
this time gets it far too wide outside off as Nigel is given another reason to stretch his arms
chips at this fuller one outside off uppishly behind square as this one is sent ballooning over backward point to reach the boundary
tries him out with another short one which the batsman is late on as he looks for the hook
full again on the pads as this is struck back towards the bowler on his follow through
backs away to the leg side, with the bowler following him as this one is glanced away with the angle behind square. Able to return back for the second. Looks like he is trying to do this on his own

well, as soon as I say that does the Sri Lankan captain go ahead and offer up a top-edge to this short of a length delivery on middle and leg, with this one flying high to mid-on, with Vettori putting in an excellent, forward diving catch. There is some debate over the placement of his back heel in relation to the bowling crease, but that is sorted soon enough. Sri Lanka now eight down and truly staring down the barrel
defended away to the off side
goes round the wicket to Herath as this one is defended away safely from the crease. After much deliberation as to whether to go for the run, they decide to have a go in the end

and Malinga doesn't take long to get back to his seat in the pavilion as he offers a chance straightaway to Ronchi, almost following the line of the ball as this one caught the outside edge on the way to the NZ keeper
and he gets off the mark right away with a clip to the leg side to end a successful over for the hosts
134 kph, begins with a lovely, length delivery outside off which is shouldered arms to
has a waft again at this length delivery outside off, but is late on it
brings up the length on the same channel, with this one getting some reverse swing as it went past the flashing blade of Lakmal
another play-and-a-miss outside off from Lakmal
fuller now, with the line about the same, as Lakmal just can't make a sweet connection
shifts the line a touch closer to the batsman now as this one is driven firmly to the cover fielder
finds a good length outside off which the batsman is late on as he has a go
this time dabbed away off the back foot through point to pickup the single
gives the Sri Lankans fan something to cheer for as he slams Southee through backward point to find the boundary
brings the bat down in the nick of time to this fuller length just outside off

short from the bowler as this is hooked straight to square-leg, who takes a shy at the striker's end after seeing the batsman off his line, which he nails down, but not before the batsman had made his ground
finishes with a pearl of a bouncer which has Herath ducking for cover
Lakmal looking to get in some batting practice as he has another go at this Milne special outside off
pitched up outside off as this one is driven straight to mid-off
follows him a tick with this full, inswinging delivery on middle and leg

and Herath gets his helmet tested as he is struck right on the grille as he fails to keep his eye on the ball. Straightaway Milne walks over to check on his welfare, with a number of other NZ fielders jogging up to Herath to make sure all is well. Struck him right on the emblem, just above the peak of the helmet. Herath, the champ, shows no distress
able to negotiate this fuller one away towards the point region
goes round the wicket for the final ball as Herath utilises the angle to help this down to deep fine leg
starts off with a short of a length outside off which is defended off the back foot
eased away off the back foot towards mid-on
shorter one from Southee which is pulled away rather uppishly over midwicket
stands his ground to blaze away this length delivery through the covers
goes for the shorter one which is penalised by the umpire
clipped away off the back foot through midwicket for one
tries him from round the wicket now as he plays at this fuller one, but is late on it as it goes across
tests the third umpire's patience with a shorter one, but Llong is having none of it
and Anderson completes the rout by getting Herath to spoon this length delivery straight to the cover fielder as the Hagley Oval erupts in approval
